title: If two things coexist, can they still live without each other? - Quora

response.answer_text: Based on the definition: to exist together or at the same time. to exist separately or independently but peaceably, often while remaining rivals or adversaries: - from Google search There is no reason why two things could NOT live without each other.

Coexist. Coexist may not mean dependance on each other, or it means adaptability. Look at human relationships, marriage, live together ‘coexist’ but they can seperate, adjust, get divorced, or live in the same house and ignore each other. This example speaks for other situations in Nature.
